content: Optimized module script loading leading to reduced memory usage, especially for Windows users.
In Luau user-defined type functions, it is now possible to reference regular type aliases.
Adds Class.Bone.LocalCFrame and Class.Bone.WorldCFrame properties.
Allows Class.Attachment objects to have any parent.

You can now visualize Class.WrapTarget cage mesh vertices before and after deformation with Class.WrapDeformer. By default, visualization shows post-deformation vertices, but the new debug visualization setting Enum.WrapTargetDebugMode.PreWrapDeformerCage lets you view the Class.WrapTarget cage vertices prior to deformation.
Improves replication of simulated physics.
Adds a "Default" device option when selecting input and output audio devices.
Fixes meshes not getting rendered on some GPUs running GLES3.
In the New Luau Type Solver, autocomplete for assignments should provide more helpful suggestions.
Updated the type signature of the setmetatable builtin to use the setmetatable type function.
Fixes bugs that could cause the pathfinding navigation mesh visualization to flicker or fail to render under certain conditions.
New Explorer - Fixed a rare direction == 0, which would imply target == anchor bug.
Fix scrolling of Class.ScrollingFrame|ScrollingFrames in Class.BillboardGui|BillboardGuis via the mouse wheel.
Fixes an issue in Class.Textbox where text is duplicated when long sequences of whitespace are present.
Smooth-skinned avatars no longer have seams at part boundaries when undergoing deformation by Class.WrapDeformer|WrapDeformers.
Fixes an issue where unicode in the user directory name could cause sound files to fail to load.
Parts created on the client are now destroyed when they hit the killplane.
Makes Class.AudioEcho.RampTime use 50% less CPU.
Makes accessories for R6 avatars have Class.BasePart.AudioCanCollide set to false by default.
Improves incremental autocomplete’s support for completions on union types in Luau’s old Type Solver.
Fixes an issue where Sounds and AudioPlayers can fail to play properly when calling Stop() and Play() in quick succession.
In Luau's New Type Solver, fixes a bug where generic type packs would erroneously produce unknown symbol errors.
Fixes an issue where a freshly-created Class.AudioEmitter or Class.AudioListener that uses custom distance or angle attenuation curves produces an audible click.
Adds PackageLink as instance to ignore when cloning for Texture Generator
